message.content:
We first extract the necessary numbers from the statements and then calculate each ratio as follows.

1. ROE (Return on Equity):  
For ROE we use the net profit from the income statement and the average owner’s equity.  
• Net Profit = –1,352,379.63  
• Owner’s Equity at the beginning (from the balance sheet) = 13,000,000.00  
• Owner’s Equity at the end = 11,647,620.37  
• The average owner’s equity = (13,000,000.00 + 11,647,620.37) / 2 = 12,323,810.185  
Then,  
  ROE = (Net Profit) / (Average Equity)  
    = –1,352,379.63 / 12,323,810.185  
    ≈ –0.1097 or –10.97%

2. Debt to Asset Ratio:  
This ratio is calculated by dividing total liabilities by total assets (we use end-of-period figures).  
• Total Liabilities (from balance sheet; here only current liabilities are provided) = Accounts Payable + Taxes Payable = 450,000.00 + 287,762.05 = 737,762.05  
• Total Assets at end = 12,385,382.42  
Thus,  
  Debt-to-Asset Ratio = 737,762.05 / 12,385,382.42  
    ≈ 0.0596, which we round to 0.06

3. Gross Profit Margin:  
This margin is calculated using the gross profit and total revenue from the income statement.  
• Gross Profit = 1,075,241.17  
• Total Revenue = 5,755,241.17  
Thus,  
  Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100  
    = (1,075,241.17 / 5,755,241.17) × 100  
    ≈ 18.68%

Now we present the results in the required JSON format.

{
  "solution": {
    "Return on Equity (ROE)": "-10.97%",
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.06",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "18.68%"
  }
}
